cover.alt: How to Delete pivot table from Excel Sheet in Python

steps: Install Aspose.Cells for Python via pip.
Load the Excel workbook that contains your pivot table.
Access the worksheet where the pivot table exists.
Use the pivot_tables collection to locate the pivot table.
Call the remove_pivot_table() method to delete the pivot table.
Save the workbook after deletion.

faqs.q: How do I delete a pivot table in Excel using Python?
faqs.a: You can delete a pivot table by accessing the worksheet’s pivot_tables collection and calling remove_pivot_table() using Aspose.Cells for Python via .NET.

faqs.q: Can I delete multiple Pivot Tables at once?
faqs.a: Yes. You can loop through the pivot_tables collection and remove each one by its index or condition.

faqs.q: Does deleting a pivot table remove its source data?
faqs.a: No. The pivot table is deleted, but the source data remains untouched in your worksheet.

faqs.q: Do I need Microsoft Excel installed to use Aspose.Cells?
faqs.a: No. Aspose.Cells is a standalone API and does not require Microsoft Excel to be installed.

posts.title: Detect Hyperlink Type in Excel with Aspose.Cells for .NET
posts.description: You can find different types of hyperlinks in an Excel file like external, cell reference, file path and email using C# or VB.NET.
headings: Detect Hyperlink TypeThere can be different types of hyperlinks which can be used in an Excel file like external, cell reference, file path and email. Our new release has introduced an enumerator **TargetModeType** which represents the type of hyperlink. A new property **LinkType** is introduced in Hyperlink class which return the hyperlink type using above mentioned enumerator. See the document on how to [detect different types of hyperlinks][4] for your complete reference. Here is an example which can be used to exercise this new feature. {{< gist aspose-com-gists 922f990b02cf4e04a328bd6f37029af8 "Examples-CSharp-Workbook-DetectLinkTypes-1.cs" >}}

Get Total Page Count before PDF or Image RenderingWell, the title is explaining this new feature. When a file has too many pages, the process of converting to pdf/image may use too much memory and CPU, and OOM exception may be thrown. Getting total pages count before converting can indicate this risk, and do some actions (e.g. skip this file) or print the selected pages to avoid the undesired results. For example one of my sample Excel file (870 KB) was showing about 38 million pages. Just imagine, what will happen if you come across a conversion containing such a huge number of pages. Following is an example to show the usage of new classes **SheetPrintingPreview** and **WorkbookPrintingPreview**. Both of these classes contain a property **EvaluatedPageCount** which returns the page count of the printout or PDF file. {{< gist aspose-com-gists 922f990b02cf4e04a328bd6f37029af8 "Examples-CSharp-Workbook-PrintPreview-1.cs" >}} See the document on [printing preview workbook and worksheet][5] for your complete reference.

Extracting Embedded MOL FileAs you know that molecular data file created in the MDL Molfile format, a chemical file format; contains plain text information and stores information about atoms and bonds; often used as a standard exchange format for molecular information. This type of file can be embedded in the Excel file. In this latest release, support is provided to extract object of such an uncommon type i.e. MOL. The following code snippet demonstrates extracting embedded MOL file and saving it to disk. {{< gist aspose-com-gists 922f990b02cf4e04a328bd6f37029af8 "Examples-CSharp-Workbook-ExtractEmbeddedMolFile-1.cs" >}} See the document [on extract embedded MOL file][6] for your reference.

frontmatter.seoTitle: Convert TXT File to CSV in Python | Python TXT to CSV
frontmatter.description: Learn how to convert a text file (TXT) to CSV format in Python using Aspose.Cells for Python. Includes steps and Python TXT to CSV code examples.
frontmatter.author: Muzammil Khan

tags: convert txt file to csv python

cover.alt: Convert TXT File to CSV in Python
cover.caption: Convert TXT File to CSV in Python

steps: Install the library using `pip install aspose-cells`.
Import the required classes from Aspose.Cells.
Load the TXT file using the `Workbook` class.
Save the workbook in CSV format using `save('output.csv', SaveFormat.CSV)`.
Optionally, use `TxtLoadOptions` to handle custom delimiters such as tab or semicolon.

faqs.q: Can I convert multiple TXT files to CSV at once?
faqs.a: Yes. You can loop through all text files in a directory and convert each file using Aspose.Cells.

faqs.q: Does Aspose.Cells require Microsoft Excel installed?
faqs.a: No. Aspose.Cells is a standalone library and does not depend on Microsoft Excel or any external software

faqs.q: Can I perform other conversions such as CSV to Excel or Excel to JSON?
faqs.a: Yes. Aspose.Cells supports conversions among various formats including XLSX, XLS, ODS, HTML, and JSON.

posts.description: Protect and unprotect Excel files programmatically using C#. Protect workbooks using password and set the desired protection type using .NET Excel API.
headings: C# Library to Protect Excel Files {#API-to-protect-Excel-files}

frontmatter.title: Protect and Unprotect Excel Files using C#
frontmatter.seoTitle: Protect and Unprotect Excel File in C# | Password Protect Excel
frontmatter.description: Protect and unprotect Excel files programmatically using C#. Protect workbooks using password and set the desired protection type using .NET Excel API.
frontmatter.author: Usman Aziz
frontmatter.summary: People often use it to work with data, like for finance or human resources tasks. faqs.q: What is a slicer in Excel?
faqs.a: A slicer is a visual filter that lets you filter PivotTables or charts using clickable buttons instead of dropdowns. It helps users interact with data more easily.

faqs.q: How do I add a slicer to an Excel chart using C#?
faqs.a: Create a PivotChart from a PivotTable, then add a slicer linked to that PivotTable. The slicer will automatically filter both the table and chart dynamically.

faqs.q: Can I edit slicers programmatically in Excel?
faqs.a: Yes. Using Aspose.Cells for .NET, you can modify slicer properties such as name, position, and number of columns through C# code.

faqs.q: Do I need Microsoft Excel installed to use Aspose.Cells?
faqs.a: No. Aspose.Cells for .NET works independently of Microsoft Excel. You can create, modify, and save Excel files programmatically without any external dependencies.

faqs.q: How can I try Aspose.Cells for free?
faqs.a: You can request a [Free Temporary License](https://purchase.aspose.com/temporary-license/) to evaluate the full functionality of Aspose.Cells without limitations.

faqs.q: Is there a free way to convert an HTML file into Excel?
faqs.a: Yes, you can use free online tools like [Aspose.Cells Conversion](https://products.aspose.app/cells/conversion/html-to-xlsx).

faqs.q: Can I convert multiple HTML files to Excel at once?

faqs.q: Does converting HTML to Excel preserve table formatting?
faqs.a: Yes, when using Aspose.Cells, it maintains the table structure, formatting, and embedded styles.

faqs.q: Can I convert HTML to CSV instead of Excel?

frontmatter.title: Convert HTML to Excel in Python
frontmatter.seoTitle: Convert HTML to Excel in Python | Python HTML to Excel
frontmatter.description: Learn how to convert HTML to Excel in Python. Load HTML files or strings, apply custom options, and export to XLSX, XLS, or CSV formats programmatically.
frontmatter.author: Muzammil Khan
frontmatter.summary: Learn how to convert HTML to Excel in Python using Aspose.Cells for Python. Load an HTML file or string and save it as XLSX, XLS, or CSV with ease. Apply advanced options for formatting and memory optimization to handle large datasets effectively.

cover.alt: Convert HTML to Excel in Python
cover.caption: Convert HTML to Excel in Python

steps: Install Aspose.Cells for Python via .NET using the command: `pip install aspose-cells`.
Import the required class from the library: `from aspose.cells import Workbook`.
Load your HTML file by creating a Workbook instance: `workbook = Workbook('sample.html')`.
Optionally, define HtmlLoadOptions to auto-fit columns or preserve formatting.
Save the loaded HTML data as Excel: `workbook.save('output.xlsx')`.

faqs.q: Can I convert HTML directly to Excel using Python?
faqs.a: Yes. You can convert any HTML file or string containing table data directly to Excel using the Aspose.Cells for Python via .NET library. It reads the HTML structure and preserves tables, formatting, and styles in the output Excel file.

faqs.q: Does Aspose.Cells support converting HTML strings to Excel?
faqs.a: Absolutely. You can load HTML content from a string or memory stream instead of a file. This is useful when HTML is dynamically generated from web data, APIs, or user input.

faqs.q: What output formats are supported besides XLSX?
faqs.a: In addition to XLSX, you can export HTML data to XLS, CSV, ODS, or PDF. Simply specify the required SaveFormat when saving your workbook.

faqs.q: Do I need Microsoft Excel installed to use Aspose.Cells?
faqs.a: No. Aspose.Cells for Python via .NET is a standalone library that does not require Microsoft Excel or any external software.

faqs.q: Is there an online tool to convert HTML to Excel without coding?
faqs.a: Yes. Try the free [Aspose.Cells HTML to Excel Converter](https://products.aspose.app/cells/conversion/html-to-xlsx) to convert HTML files online directly in your browser.

faqs.q: Can Aspose.Cells handle large or complex HTML tables?
faqs.a: Yes. The library efficiently handles large HTML files and complex layouts with multiple tables and embedded styles while maintaining accuracy.
